page.title: 07Greve de Lecq Barracks
page.content:
At Greve de lecq there are six buildings which make up Greve de Lecq barracks. The Jersey militia were stationed here in times past. They slept there and kept their horses in stables. Now, it is a museum and, while camping nearby, our class paid them a visit.
We saw original soldiers beds made from straw, helmets, photographs, a medical box, ablutions (wash house) with water pump (it was covered in algae). There was also a gift shop and nine old Jersey carriages. It is owned by the National Trust for Jersey and visiting times are Tuesday to Friday in the summer. Admission is 25p for adults and 10p for children.
